intro: Votschia, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Votschia species are shrubs or small trees, typically reaching heights of up to 3 meters. They play an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
